controller

Class RiskController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • controller.RiskController

  • public class RiskController
extends java.util.Observable
    Controls the game of Risk, as the name suggests. Maintains a list of Players and every possible Territory. Handles gameplay, including board setup and turns, until a winner is declared.
    Author:
    Steven Broussard, Elizabeth Harris, Jeremy Jalnos, Becca Simon

    • Constructor Detail

      • RiskController

        public RiskController(java.util.ArrayList<Player> myPlayers)
        Constructor for the Run6Bots testing class. Constructs a new RiskController object from a given ArrayList. Calls helper methods to set up all possible territories, give each Player that list, set up the deck of cards, have players claim territories and allocate armies, and handle gameplay to the end of the game.
        Parameters:
        myPlayers -

      • RiskController

        public RiskController()
        Constructor for the GUI. Constructs a new RiskController object, calling helper methods to set up all possible territories and set up the deck.

    • Method Detail

      • populateBoard

        public void populateBoard()
        Helper method for the first stage of gameplay. Allots each Player the appropriate number of armies, and has them place armies on territories in turn.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        Helper method for the second (main) stage of gameplay. While there is more than one Player left in the game, has players take turns. A turn has three stages: First, the player is given armies based on how many territories he controls and places them on his territories. The player also has the option to turn in a set of cards for an additional army bonus. Second, the player attacks other players' territories in an attempt to conquer more territories. Third, when the player is finished attacking, he has the option to fortify his territories by moving armies from one to another. If the player conquered at least one opposing territory on his turn, he is issued a card from the deck.

      • sendTerritoriesToPlayers

        public void sendTerritoriesToPlayers()
        Helper method for game setup. Gives each player access to the list of all territories on the Risk world map.
